title: General Manager- Michelin/James Beard/Forbes Experience
description:
We are seeking an experienced and dynamic General Manager to join our team. We pride ourselves on delivering exceptional dining experiences. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record of excellence in hospitality management, with a keen eye for detail, impeccable customer service skills, and a passion for creating memorable dining experiences.

**Responsibilities:**

* **Team Leadership:** Lead, motivate, and mentor the front of house team to deliver outstanding service consistently. Provide ongoing training and support to ensure staff are knowledgeable about menu items, wine pairings, service standards, and guest interactions.
* **Service Excellence:** Oversee all front of house operations to ensure seamless service delivery. Monitor dining room flow, reservations, and guest satisfaction levels, intervening as necessary to address any issues or concerns promptly.
* **Quality Assurance:** Uphold the highest standards of quality and presentation in all aspects of service, from table settings to food and beverage service. Conduct regular inspections to ensure cleanliness, organization, and adherence to health and safety regulations.
* **Guest Relations:** Foster a welcoming and hospitable atmosphere for guests, anticipating their needs and preferences to enhance their dining experience. Handle guest inquiries, feedback, and complaints with professionalism and efficiency, striving to exceed expectations at every opportunity.
* **Financial Management:** Work closely with the management team to develop and implement strategies for maximizing revenue, controlling costs, and achieving profitability targets. Monitor inventory levels, manage ordering and purchasing processes, and analyze sales data to identify opportunities for growth.
* **Collaboration:** Collaborate with the culinary team to ensure seamless coordination between front and back of house operations. Communicate effectively with chefs, sommeliers, and other team members to maintain consistency and quality across all aspects of the dining experience.
* **Training and Development:** Develop and implement ongoing training programs to enhance the skills and knowledge of front of house staff. Provide regular feedback and performance evaluations to support career development and progression within the team.

**Qualifications:**

* Proven experience as a General Manager in a Michelin-starred, James Beard-recognized, or Forbes-rated restaurant.
* Extensive knowledge of fine dining service standards, wine service, and food pairing.
* Exceptional leadership and interpersonal skills, with the ability to inspire and motivate a diverse team.
* Strong organizational and problem-solving abilities, with a keen attention to detail.
* Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, with the ability to interact confidently with guests and colleagues at all levels.
* Proficiency in restaurant management software and Microsoft Office Suite.
* Bachelor's degree in Hospitality Management or related field preferred.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $85,000.00 - $120,000.00 per year

title: Wine Specialist (Full-Time)
description:
**\\*\\*Must have Advanced Wine Knowledge\\*\\***

Our Wine store offers hundreds of wines from all over the world. In this role, you’ll serve as the product knowledge expert for wine, building relationships and customer loyalty by proactively providing personalized solutions and pairing suggestions that create interest and enthusiasm for our products and deliver incredible, knowledge based service.

**What will I do?**

* Lead with our values, always help others and ensure the Company remains a great place to work for all
* Educate and develop employees, engage in meaningful conversations, build trusted relationships and provide the resources, feedback, and development opportunities they need to be successful
* Develop a wine culture throughout the store; educating others on wine industry, production, regions, varietals, and tasting methods; coordinate team member and customer education on wines
* Coordinate events and featured product displays around current Merchandising priorities
* Set and achieve sales goals for targeted products; execute priorities; monitor and influence positive results in wine sales, contribution and customer engagement
* Execute Merchandising priorities, while also being empowered to make decisions that delight the customer and build sales and loyalty
* Partner with the Manager and Company Consultants in response to Top Customer requests to source rare wine selections and to oversee the fine wine room; highlight wine in well-merchandised collections to peak customer’s interests and grow sales
* Stay up-to-date on wine industry, regions, varietals and taste profiles; continuously learn about new products and services and share that knowledge with others
* Ensure products are available for customers by ordering and replenishing product; continuously look for and share ways to improve operations
* Perform other tasks essential to the proper functioning of the operation as needed

**Required Qualifications:**

* Customer service experience in restaurant, grocery or liquor retail setting
* Advanced knowledge of Wine industry, regions, production and tasting methods; including French, Italian, California, Sparkling and other fine wines
* Able to communicate complex information in simple terms
* Experience with merchandising, meal pairing, event planning or customer relations
* Passion for people and enthusiasm and knowledge of relevant products and services

**Preferred Qualifications:**

title: Audio Visual Project Manager
description:
Role: Project Manager



Contract Type: Permanent



Salary: $105,000 - $130,000



Location: New York

 **Role Summary**



\\*This position includes travel to the NY office and client sites as needed\\*



As the Project Manager, your main responsibility will be to oversee Audio Visual projects for strategic clients. Project point of contact, ensuring world class service delivery. This position is responsible for managing the project budgets, schedules and team, internally and externally. Duties include overseeing project stages including: post-award project planning, design, design process, project sequencing, project logistics, installation, offsite rack build and programming/configuration process. Ability to work closely with a global delivery team developing strong relationships is required. Excellent communication strategy with internal and external partners.  



  

**Duties and Responsibilities**


* Ensure that projects are completed in a timely and efficient manner in compliance with all service contracts.
* Take full responsibility of commercial and contractual obligations of multiple projects simultaneously.
* Prepare and manage project plans, schedules and budgets providing updates as needed.
* Communicate project progress and status with all project stakeholders, internal and external, through regular reports and updates.
* Manage project scheduling and staffing with internal and external partners.
* Oversee project site managers and installers ensuring projects deliverables are met.
* Manage completion and delivery of final documentation packages (i.e., O & M manuals, ‘RECORD’ schematics, etc.) are prepared and contract close-out occurs in a timely manner.
* Liaise between accounts receivable & payable for project invoicing.
* Forecast invoicing and work effort throughout portfolio.
* Have a solutions-based mindset understanding that success and failure is in the hands of the project team. A process must be devised for maximum chance of success. This requires passion, adaptability, creativity, and commitment.
Travel may be required for this position.  
* 

  

**Skills Profile**



To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform the following satisfactorily; other duties may be assigned. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.


* Ability to look at process improvement
* Willingness to work as part of a global team
* Ability to interface well with clients and peers to lead staff effectively.
* Strong presentation skills
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
* Ability to manage several projects simultaneously.
* Well organized with attention to detail.
* Advanced knowledge of MS Project preferred but not essential.
* Able to create and manage schedules and budgets.
* Experience in the AV industry.
Technical knowledge of AV industry preferred but not essential.  
* 

  

**Competencies:**



To perform the job successfully, an individual should demonstrate the following.


**Continuous Learning** - Assesses own strengths and weaknesses. Pursues training and development opportunities. Seeks feedback to improve performance. Shares expertise with others. Strives to continuously build knowledge and skills.


**Customer Service** - Displays courtesy and sensitivity. Manages difficult or emotional customer situations. Meets commitments. Responds promptly to customer needs. Solicits customer feedback to improve service.


**Planning & Organization** - Integrates changes smoothly. Plans for additional resources. Prioritizes and plans work activities. Sets goals and objectives. Uses time efficiently. Works in an organized manner.


**Problem Solving** - Develops alternative solutions. Gathers and analyzes information skilfully. Identify problems in a timely manner. Resolve problems in early stages. Works well in group problem solving situations.


**Teamwork** - Balances team and individual responsibilities. Contributes to building a positive team spirit. Exhibits objectivity and openness to others' views. Gives and welcomes feedback. Balances team success with personal success.


**Use of Technology** - Adapts to new technologies. Demonstrates required skills. Keeps technical skills up to date. Troubleshoots technological problems. Uses technology to increase productivity.

 **Qualifications****:** To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

  

**Reasoning Ability:**



Apply common sense understanding to carry out instructions furnished in written, oral, or diagram form. Deal with problems involving several concrete variables in standardized situations.

 **Computer Skills:** Proficient in using Microsoft Office, Excel, Word, MS Project

 **Certificates and Licenses:** Prince2/PMP qualification or equivalent.

  

The above job description is not intended to be an all-inclusive list of duties and standards of the position. Incumbents will follow any other instructions, and perform any other related duties, as assigned by their supervisor.

title: Chef de Cuisine
description:
We are seeking an accomplished and experienced Chef de Cuisine to join our esteemed culinary team at our high-end restaurant. As Chef de Cuisine, you will play a pivotal role in maintaining the highest standards of culinary excellence while providing leadership and direction to our kitchen staff. This is a unique opportunity for a talented chef with a proven track record of success in renowned establishments.

Responsibilities:

* Assist the Executive Chef in overseeing all aspects of the kitchen operations, including menu development, food preparation, and presentation, ensuring that every dish reflects the exceptional quality and creativity expected from our establishment.
* Collaborate closely with the Executive Chef and management team to create innovative and seasonally-inspired menus that showcase the finest ingredients and flavors, while also meeting the preferences and expectations of our discerning clientele.

title: FOH Manager- Michelin/James Beard/Forbes Experience
description:
We are seeking an experienced and dynamic Front of House Manager to join our team. We pride ourselves on delivering exceptional dining experiences. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record of excellence in hospitality management, with a keen eye for detail, impeccable customer service skills, and a passion for creating memorable dining experiences.

**Responsibilities:**

* **Team Leadership:** Lead, motivate, and mentor the front of house team to deliver outstanding service consistently. Provide ongoing training and support to ensure staff are knowledgeable about menu items, wine pairings, service standards, and guest interactions.
* **Service Excellence:** Oversee all front of house operations to ensure seamless service delivery. Monitor dining room flow, reservations, and guest satisfaction levels, intervening as necessary to address any issues or concerns promptly.
* **Quality Assurance:** Uphold the highest standards of quality and presentation in all aspects of service, from table settings to food and beverage service. Conduct regular inspections to ensure cleanliness, organization, and adherence to health and safety regulations.
* **Guest Relations:** Foster a welcoming and hospitable atmosphere for guests, anticipating their needs and preferences to enhance their dining experience. Handle guest inquiries, feedback, and complaints with professionalism and efficiency, striving to exceed expectations at every opportunity.
* **Financial Management:** Work closely with the management team to develop and implement strategies for maximizing revenue, controlling costs, and achieving profitability targets. Monitor inventory levels, manage ordering and purchasing processes, and analyze sales data to identify opportunities for growth.
* **Collaboration:** Collaborate with the culinary team to ensure seamless coordination between front and back of house operations. Communicate effectively with chefs, sommeliers, and other team members to maintain consistency and quality across all aspects of the dining experience.
* **Training and Development:** Develop and implement ongoing training programs to enhance the skills and knowledge of front of house staff. Provide regular feedback and performance evaluations to support career development and progression within the team.

**Qualifications:**

* Proven experience as a Front of House Manager in a Michelin-starred, James Beard-recognized, or Forbes-rated restaurant.
* Extensive knowledge of fine dining service standards, wine service, and food pairing.
* Exceptional leadership and interpersonal skills, with the ability to inspire and motivate a diverse team.
* Strong organizational and problem-solving abilities, with a keen attention to detail.
* Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, with the ability to interact confidently with guests and colleagues at all levels.
* Proficiency in restaurant management software and Microsoft Office Suite.
* Bachelor's degree in Hospitality Management or related field preferred.

title: Dog Walker Needed in Fort Greene and Clinton Hill
description:
**Join the Bark Support® pet care family! We are a well-established, small, and family-owned dog walking and pet care company located in the vibrant Fort Greene/Clinton Hill area.**

**We are currently seeking a Stellar Dog Walker/Pet Care Associate to join our small team.** The position requires availability from Monday to Friday, with working hours from at least 10 AM to 5 PM (flexibility is much appreciated), and the ability to work 1-2 weekends per month.

**The pets and pet owners value commitment and we ask for a minimum commitment of at least 1 year.** 

As part of our team, you will become an integral part of our community, considering our neighbors and clients as family.

We expect our team members to share passion for dogs, demonstrating genuine care for animals of various sizes, ages, temperaments, and quirks.

Your role involves not only caring for the pets but also caring and respecting their parents, their home, the community, and working as one with the Bark Support Team​.

We are looking for individuals who are motivated to always give their best, naturally care for others and strongly consider others' expectations, have excellent organizational skills, possess a positive attitude, and are reliable. The job demands a lot of walking and being outside a lot, technical skills, physical stamina, and an understanding of dogs behaviors, pet first aid, and city laws - all of which you will be trained on.

**KEY BENEFITS:**

* Comprehensive training is paid and provided.
* Compensation is per-appointment basis, not per hour, and it averages to $20-$30 per hour.
* Additional pay for early mornings, evenings, weekends, and holidays.
* A set day-to-day schedule will be provided only after you successfully completed the training stage and become the primary caretaker for a group of pups.
* You will have an assigned a walking route within a small neighborhood radius.
* We will meet your minimum weekly financial target and you can work more if it fits your capability and schedule.
* Provided working gear and equipment.
* Opportunities for personal and professional growth in pet handling, client relations, communication skills, time management, and more.
* Work in a historic Brooklyn neighborhood and in a community that values integrity!

**REQUIREMENTS FOR THIS POSITION:**

* Availability to work from Monday to Friday, at least between 10AM - 5PM.
* Willingness to work 1-2 weekends per month and some holidays.
* Advantageous to have an earlier start (8AM/9AM) or coverage after 6PM (not mandatory).
* Commitment to a minimum of 1 year.
* Commute time to Clinton Hill/Fort Greene is 25 minutes or less.
* Ability to handle the physical demands, walking a lot, and handling multiple dogs (2-4 at most).
* Adaptable to challenges during walks and willing to work outdoors regardless of the weather conditions.
* Genuinely care for all pets in your care, have an understanding of their personalities, and will communicate, and engage with them.
* You are focused, organized, and have the ABILITY TO PAY ATTENTION TO DETAILS.
* Warm and caring personality, you are a person who puts others first.
* Tech-savvy on an Android smartphone with basic knowledge of Google Apps.
* Ability to ride a bicycle (useful but not necessary).

**This role may be challenging, especially during the initial 2-3 weeks of training and onboarding. Once you pass through the training phase, you will be dancing on the sidewalk with the pups in your care!**

**To be considered, please submit a short cover letter along with your resume, sharing a bit about yourself, your life goals, personal interests, and why you are interested in this position.**

**To apply, please send your application to hello@barksupport.com or apply through Indeed.**

**We look forward to welcoming you to Team Bark Support!**

Job Types: Part-time, Contract

Pay: $600.00 - $1,000.00 per week

Expected hours: 30 – 35 per week

Benefits:

* Employee discount
* Flexible schedule
* On-the-job training
* Paid training
* Referral program

Schedule:

Application Question(s):

* Are you available to work from Monday to Friday, at least between 10 AM - 5 PM, and occasionally 1-2 weekends in a month?
* Are you able to commit at least 1 year for the position?
* Are you prepared to handle the mental and physical demands, walking multiple dogs (2-4 at most), being outside for most of the time, and adapting to different challenges that might arise during walks?
* Which neighborhood do you live in? Does your commute to Fort Greene Park require more than 25 minutes?

title: Insurance Inspector in Spring Valley and Surrounding Area (Spring Valley, NY)
description:
We're recruiting for a Senior Insurance Inspector, in **Spring Valley and the surrounding area**. If you are available in other areas, we are happy to discuss.

We do inspections differently. We get to know you. You work directly with our key staff. You have a mentor field rep who walks you through our process. We listen to what works best for you. We are super flexible. So, if any of the list below is you, we would love to hear from you:

* Do you have a good knowledge of buildings?
* Like a flexible schedule?
* Comfortable with smartphone apps
* Enjoy going doing inspections in areas you already travel in
* Can mesh our inspection work with your other jobs or free time?
* Are you good at logistics and setting appointments (are you a detail kind of person?)

If it sounds good, fill out the Indeed application.

**Here is what you can expect:**

* **If selected, we will do a 15 minute phone chat**
* **We will provide web based info for your review**
* **Attend a short “New Rep” Webinar with our rep team**
* **Get your first case(s) to try out**
* **Decide if you like working with us!**

Gardner Group is a fast-growing, regional provider of insurance loss control services in 4 states as well as a developer of the inspection software, ViewSpection.

Our field reps gather property and operations information for residential and commercial properties.

Along with gathering information about properties, the other role is to be a "defect detective". Successful applicants are usually already out and about in their defined working territory. This is not a full-time position but works very well combined with other activities where you are out on the road.

Assignments need to be completed within 20 days.

* Compensation:
* Home Inspections start at $20.00
* Commercial inspections start at $40.00 to $60.00
* Mileage fee provided

There is additional fees for making appointment contacts as well as a 15% bonus for high performing inspectors.

Gardner Group is 100% virtual. Our staff is located throughout the US

* This is a **part-time** position
* Average territory is a 40 mile radius
* 1099 contractor position
* Production payments are made every 2weeks for the last 2 weeks production

Thank you!  
Jim Gardner

title: Foster Parent Trainer
description:
**Job Description**

Abbott House is seeking a competent Foster Parent Trainer to join the Foster Care team. In this role the Foster Parent Trainer will provide the required and necessary training to foster care parents to ensure the successful placement of foster care children.

**About Abbott House**

Abbott House is an innovative community-based organization that helps children, families, adults, and people with intellectual and developmental disabilities with complex needs build lasting foundations for a promising future. We operate programs in the New York Metropolitan area and Hudson Valley.

**Key Responsibilities**

* Conduct training for foster care parents
* Connect foster care parents with community resources
* Ensures the completion of the home study process for all recruited and kinship foster families assigned, including home visits and interviews
* Maintains accurate records of each assigned foster parent including SCR clearances, medicals, fingerprints etc.
* Ensures the accurate updating of CNNX
* Working with the other Foster Family Trainers ensures the scheduling of a minimum of 10 GPSII/MAPP clusters and a minimum of 6 Caring for our Own clusters

**About You**

You are the ideal candidate for Foster Parent Trainer if you have a passion to help your community and empower underserved populations. Being compassionate, resourceful, organized, flexible and responsive are critical attributes to be successful in this role.

* You have at least a Bachelor’s in Social Work. Master's degree is preferred
* You have a valid driver's license and drive your own vehicle
* You have at least 2 years of experience working with child welfare
* You are familiar with NYS DSS/ACS regulations
* You are MAPP Certified

**What We Offer:**

* Professional growth opportunities
* Medical, Dental, Prescription Drug and Vision Care benefits with premiums substantially paid by for employees, employee families and domestic partners
* Generous vacation, holiday, sick time, and personal time off benefits
* Tuition Reimbursement

* Paid Family Leave Program

title: Video Editor
description:
Key role in the shooting and assembly of finished video projects that meet the Peerless Umbrella and goals. The Videographer/Editor will support multiple pre- and post-production corporate media projects ranging from branded content and corporate work involving social media, communications, training, promotional, and informational videos. This role will act as an integral member and collaborate with other members of the Creative Team.
  
Essential Duties & Responsibilities (Other duties may be assigned):
  
Collaborate with producers, writers, editors, and others on the Creative Team to identify video solutions that achieve business objectives.
  
Creatively engage with stakeholders during every phase of the production process.
  
Understand visual composition and studio production.
  
Maintain working knowledge of production equipment, including audio and lighting equipment for field and studio production.
  
Keep abreast, research and implement new editing technologies and industry best practices to maximize efficiency.
  
Execute editing needs and provide expertise, knowledge, and creativity to meet project goals and needs.
  
Refine audio through sound mixing or other post-production work.
  
Review content for accuracy and maintain video archives.
  
Review, evaluate, edit and cut footage ensuring final version communicates information as planned.
  
Handle complex issues or project changes independently; Seek help from management as necessary.
  
Solid foundation with all aspects of video post-production, media archiving and management.
  
Position and edit footage into sequence and input music, dialogue, graphics, effects, etc.
  
Awareness of social media current trends, best practices, and comfortable creating content for our various social media audiences.
  
Minimum Qualifications (These are the requirements that all applicants MUST HAVE to be considered for this position):
  
Bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution or equivalent experience.
  
2 years of experience in a combination of video editing and videography.
  
Expertise using Adobe CC (After Effects, Premiere, Photoshop, etc.)
  
Extensive experience using motion graphics.
  
Extensive experience using cameras and lighting techniques for a cinematic look.
  
Creative mind and storytelling skills.
  
Thorough knowledge of timing, motivation, and continuity.
  
Demonstrate shooting and video editing ability with a strong reel or body of work.
  
  

**Preferred Qualifications:**  

Bachelor’s degree in film studies or a related field.
  
3 years of experience in a combination of video editing and videography.
  
Motion Graphics Design and Animation experience.
  
Experience in 3D modeling.
  
Comfortable and willing to embrace video AI tools.

title: Campaign Manager, Programmatic
description:
**Company Description**  

Zenith is a full-service media agency with capabilities and expertise across all channels and disciplines. Zenith is part of Publicis Media, the #1 media buying network in the Americas and #2 globally. As “The ROI Agency,” Zenith’s expertise lies in driving real, tangible business outcomes, not just media metrics, that will have a measurable effect on our clients’ business. Every investment we make has an ROI mindset—not just for our clients, but for our agency at large. We’re focused on driving the maximum value for our people, our capabilities and our media investments for some of the world’s leading brands.

 **Job Description**  

The Zenith Precision team is passionate about data and advocates for and trains communication planning teams to leverage live data to surface audience insights and uncover new audience segments. This highly focused team is dedicated to leveraging Ad Tech in order to achieve this goal.


The Campaign Manager owns strategic planning and campaign execution for an assigned client. This position is both strategic and tactical in scope, requiring the Campaign Manager to independently generate strategic insights for the campaigns in his/her portfolio and implement campaigns with the support of Campaign Specialists. Campaign Managers train Campaign Specialists on client specific requirements, providing expertise in optimization strategies and guidance on best practices related to client communication.


The ideal candidate will have prior online trafficking and campaign management experience, strong analytical and communication skills, and prior experience with bid management platforms and active campaign optimization. Campaign Managers must possess a strong inner drive to contribute.

**Responsibilities:**

* Effectively communicate digital strategies and rational for tactical approaches for each campaign
* Execute, manage, and optimize online media campaigns and programs for agency clients (e.g. auction/exchange based performance media, audience-based buying, remarketing campaigns) while meeting or surpassing client performance expectations
* Oversight of larger and more strategic accounts and client relationships
* Develop, grow, and maintain relationships with AOD customers through exceptional client service
* Formulate proposals for new client opportunities
* Manage the delivery of creative assets, insertion orders, campaign artifacts, and all relevant campaign documentation in preparation for campaign launch
* Partner with Analytics team on campaign measurement reporting and insights generation
* Provide regular insights to clients detailing performance, campaign optimizations, and new opportunities
* Work with media partners to ensure accurate platform implementation
* Troubleshoot issues on all pre-production and live campaigns
* Oversee campaign QA process
* Provide monthly auditing reports to Agency partners and actualize bill/pay systems when applicable
* Lead and assist in coaching, managing, and educating Campaign Managers and Campaign Specialists, helping to support campaigns
* Attend client meetings, as needed
* Participate in regular knowledge share sessions to share and learn new strategies for optimizing and enhancing campaign performance

 **Qualifications**  

* Four-year college degree
* Must have 1 year of experience in bid management, campaign management/optimization, or digital media operations
* Client facing experience with the ability to identify risks and effectively manage through issues
* Understanding of traditional and interactive media planning elements
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office solutions
* Strong analytical thinking and mathematical skills
* Excellent communication and writing skills
* Strong project management skills
* Strong desire to contribute to a team

  

**Additional Information**  

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.


Compensation Range: $62,000 - $65,000 annually. This is the pay range the Company believes it will pay for this position at the time of this posting. Consistent with applicable law, compensation will be determined based on the skills, qualifications, and experience of the applicant along with the requirements of the position, and the Company reserves the right to modify this pay range at any time. For this role, the Company will offer medical coverage, dental, vision, disability, 401k, and paid time off. The Company anticipates the application deadline for this job posting will be 06/08/2024.

description:
Job Overview:  
We are seeking an experienced Equipment Operator to join our team. As an Equipment Operator, you will be responsible for operating a variety of heavy machinery and equipment to perform tasks such as digging, bulldozing, loading, and transporting materials. This is a physically demanding role that requires strong technical skills and attention to detail.

Responsibilities:

title: Housekeeper
description:
**Work With Purpose**

  

At Five Star Senior Living, our people are the critical link to those we serve, and it is their vitality, energy, and caring nature that allows us to fulfill our mission of enriching and inspiring the journey of life. In addition to nurturing and advancing the lives of our residents, our team members enjoy meaningful opportunities for personal and professional growth, within a supportive culture centered around advancing *their* lives, as well.

**The Opportunity**


Pay Rate: $17.00-$18.72


The Housekeeper position is part of the Facilities Team responsible for maintaining a clean, safe, and comfortable environment for our residents.




**What You’ll Do**

* Keep our facilities spotlessly clean and well kept
* Clean residents’ rooms and shared areas
* Respond with urgency upon requests
* Dispose of waste
* Execute laundry service and daily changing of residents’ beds, including ironing and pressing as needed
* Inspect residents’ rooms and communal areas to ensure they are tidy
* Ensure high standards of hygiene and cleanliness at all times
* Reset areas after use, keeping safety and sanitation as a motivating factor in your work.
* Responsibilities include customer service, safety, sanitation, and communication.




**What You’ll Bring**




**POSITION REQUIREMENTS / QUALIFICATIONS:**

* Must be at least 18 years of age.
* Must pass State and Company criminal background/drug screens.
* Demonstrates effective time management skills.
* Housekeeping or related experience desired.

**We Got You**

  

We see and support the whole you. Because investing in you, and all our team members, is the first step in making a difference in the lives of others.

* Comprehensive Medical/Dental/Vision
* 401k + Match
* Competitive PTO
* Life, Disability & other supplemental benefits
* Professional Development Funds
* Wellness Coaching & Personal Support Benefits
* Recognition & Reward Programs

**Is This You?**

  

Beyond checking off the boxes, we’re looking for someone who shares our deep sense of purpose and passion for advancing the lives of others.

* **Puts People First** – You have an authentic connection to our vision of a world in which the quality of life is ageless, and a desire to advance our culture by always respecting and empowering our team members, residents, and families.
* **Customer Focused** – You strive to build and strengthen customer loyalty by delivering exceptional hospitality, thoughtful solutions, and innovative customer attraction and retention strategies.
* **Results Oriented** – You’re forward thinking, seeing the big picture as you lead with empathy and drive to exceed results. You firmly believe that the way in which we achieve results is just as important as what we accomplish together.
* **Drives Operational Excellence** – You encourage a mindset of continuous improvement. You respect ideas, collaborate, and empower others to elevate how and what we deliver for our customers and each other.
* **Embraces Change** – You’re a change driver! A positive communicator who engages all key stakeholders to help them anticipate and embrace what’s next, you’re always adjusting the target for continuous improvement.

**EEOC**

  

Five Star prohibits discrimination against any applicant or employee with regard to or on the basis of race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, age, ancestry, sex, pregnancy (including pregnancy, childbirth, lactation and related medical conditions), gender, gender identity and expression (including transgender), sexual orientation, mental or physical disability, military status, certain criminal records, genetic information (including characteristics and testing), HIV testing, a personal admission to a facility for the care and treatment of a mentally ill person and taking of parental leave or membership in any other category protected by applicable law. In addition to federal requirements, Five Star complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has communities and/or facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including, but not limited to, recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.


In addition, Five Star expressly prohibits any form of workplace harassment based on race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, age, ancestry, sex, pregnancy (including pregnancy, childbirth, lactation and related medical conditions), gender, gender identity and expression (including transgender), sexual orientation, mental or physical disability, military status, certain criminal records, genetic information (including characteristics and testing), HIV testing, a personal admission to a facility for the care and treatment of a mentally ill person and taking of parental leave or membership in any other category protected by applicable law. We will not tolerate harassment of employees in the workplace, or in other settings in which employees may find themselves in connection with their employment. Improper interference with the ability of Five Star’s employees to perform their job duties may result in discipline up to and including discharge. Additionally, retaliation, including intimidation, threats, or coercion, because an employee or applicant has objected to discrimination harassment or retaliation, engaged or may engage in filing a complaint, assisted in a review, investigation, or hearing or have otherwise sought to obtain their legal rights under any federal, state, or local law is prohibited and will not be tolerated.

title: Assistant Editor
description:
Location: Hybrid, Hoboken, NJ, USA  



Our mission is to unlock human potential. We welcome you for who you are, the background you bring, and we embrace individuals who get excited about learning. Bring your experiences, your perspectives, and your passion; it’s in our differences that we empower the way the world learns.  



The Assistant Editor is responsible for working alongside the editors on digital-based courseware products that are primarily in large undergraduate markets across Accounting, Business, Science, and Math to support the development and updates of products. The Assistant Editor will also work closely with other content management, technology, marketing, and sales teams. Responsibilities will include:
 

Assisting with market research and development activities.
 

Performing administrative tasks such as creating reports.
 

Executing contracts.
 

Managing payments.
 

Working with sales and customers to help support and drive growth.  



The position requires strong organization, communication, and teamwork skills. Customer-facing skills are required for interacting with authors, content subject matter experts and reviewers, sales, and professors.  



**How you will make an impact:**

* Supporting day-to-day functions of the Editorial team
* Contributing to the courseware product planning and development process
* Supporting the alignment of consistent workflows across the Editorial team
* Building and strengthening partnerships between editorial and our key partners in sales and marketing

**We are looking for people who have:**

* Strong data literacy skills, able to quickly adapt to new systems and platforms.
* Strong written and verbal communication skills
* Proficiency with MS Office (esp. Excel; PowerPoint) and PowerBI, Knowledge of salesforce is a plus.
* The ability to work cooperatively with others across the organization to achieve shared objectives
* The ability to persist in accomplishing objectives despite obstacles and setbacks
* Strong attention to detail and the ability to multi-task/manage a wide variety of tasks and responsibilities

**About Wiley:**

Wiley is a trusted leader in research and learning, our pioneering solutions and services are paving the way for knowledge seekers as they work to solve the world’s most important challenges. We are advocates of advancement, empowering knowledge-seekers to transform today’s biggest obstacles into tomorrow’s brightest opportunities.  



With over 200 years of experience in publishing, we continue to evolve knowledge seekers’ steps into strides, illuminating their path forward to personal, educational, and professional success at every stage. Around the globe, we break down barriers for innovators, empowering them to advance discoveries in their fields, adapt their workforces, and shape minds.  



Wiley is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. We evaluate all qualified applicants and treat all qualified applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, genetic information, or based on any individual’s status in any group or class protected by applicable federal, state or local laws. Wiley is also committed to providing reasonable accommodation to applicants and employees with disabilities. Applicants who require accommodation to participate in the job application process may contact tasupport@wiley.com for assistance.  



We are proud that our workplace promotes continual learning and internal mobility. Our values support courageous teammates, needle movers and learning champions all while striving to support the health and well-being of all employees, for example we offer meeting-free Friday afternoons allowing more time for heads down work and professional development.  



We are committed to fair, transparent pay, and we strive to provide competitive compensation in addition to a comprehensive benefits package. The range below represents Wiley’s good faith and reasonable estimate of the base pay for this role at the time of posting roles either in the UK, Canada or USA. It is anticipated that most qualified candidates will fall within the range, however the ultimate salary offered for this role may be higher or lower and will be set based on a variety of non-discriminatory factors, including but not limited to, geographic location, skills, and competencies. Wiley proactively displays target base pay range for UK, Canada and USA based roles.  



When applying, please attach your resume/CV to be considered.

title: Maintenance Specialist
description:
**Comunilife Inc.** is looking to fill a Maintenance Specialist position for its congregate program in the Bronx. The Maintenance Specialist is responsible to repair and maintain assigned premises and keep the facility clean and organized. Responsible for the general safety conditions of the assigned facility. Ensure cleanliness and maintain building(s) in good condition and repair to ensure the safety and comfort of the staff and clients and protect the Program’s physical facility. Ensures compliance with regulatory environmental standards. Other responsibilities include working harmoniously with staff in accordance with Comunilife principles and guidelines. This position is eligible for Comunilife's generous benefits and paid time off package.

**Essential Duties:**

* Monitor the Facility’s interior and exterior entrances for cleanliness (including snow removal and removal of other hazardous conditions).
* Complete Work Orders assigned in an efficient and proficient manner.
* Work in a pleasant and respectful manner with all clients.
* Assist in fire safety and evacuation drills, procedures and training.
* Alert the direct supervisor, Asst. Director, Director or designee, of any unusual occurrences or violation of rules and regulations (i.e., no smoking regulations).
* Carry out cleaning duties as assigned to ensure the building reflects the standard of hygiene outlined and as directed by Comunilife management, including care of floors, bathrooms and public areas.
* Troubleshoot and perform repairs including, but not limited to:
* Painting, patching and sheet rocking
* Light plumbing including unclogging drains and basic plumbing skills
* Light electrical (from the wall out) including replacing fixtures and lighting ballast
* Lighting in general including bulb and switch plate replacement
* Lock repair and replacement
* Floor tile repair and installation including base
* General carpentry including interior renovation, ductwork and tasks as assigned
* HVAC system cleaning, filter and belt changes
* Monitor heating and air conditioning systems, including logging and reporting problems and potential issues. Emphasis on preventative maintenance.
* Move and relocate furniture, computers, office supplies, etc. as needed.
* Take inventory of janitorial supplies, hand towels, toilet tissue, etc., regularly and ensure replacement.
* Follow and comply with all applicable health and sanitation procedures and adheres to safe work practices
* Attend training programs and meetings as instructed.
* Any additional responsibilities as deemed necessary and appropriate by the direct supervisor, Asst. Director or Director for the proper day-to-day operations of the facility, including but not limited to, cleaning snow from sidewalks during the winter, cleaning 18 inches into the street as per City regulations, and other necessary repair and maintenance duties
* High School Diploma or equivalent with at least one (1) year maintenance experience.
* Must be able to demonstrate good skills in general maintenance including cleaning, tiling, plumbing, heating, electrical etc.
* Driver’s License required for some locations

Comunilife is an EEO employer and provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

title: Veterinary Technician
description:
**Job Overview**  
Broad River Animal Hospital is looking for a skilled, compassionate and enthusiastic Veterinary Technician to join our amazing team. Schedule is flexible, however Wednesday availability is preferred.

We are a privately owned, AAHA Accredited, 4 doctor practice in Norwalk CT. We are looking to add a skilled Veterinary Technician to our clinical support team. CVT or LVT credentialing is highly preferred, however training is available for the right candidate. Our doctors provide routine examinations, preventative care, a wide range of surgical procedures, and both routine and complicated dental care. We are also thrilled to have welcomed a part time board certified Internal Medicine Specialist in 2024. We boast a great daytime schedule that prioritizes work/life balance. Our technicians are encouraged to practice at the top of their abilities and skill set.

Who YOU are:

A skilled and enthusiastic technician, looking to grow and learn in a collaborative team environment - you love helping your patients and are comfortable accurately performing skin and ear cytology, performing smooth and gentle venipuncture for blood draws and catheter placement, obtaining sterile urine samples via cystocentesis, getting that perfect diagnostic radiograph, surgery monitoring and more. You thrive as a "treatment" technician, where your primary focus will be on patient care, surgery and treatments.

Pet discount offered with part time employment.

Full time employment benefits include: Pet discount, health care, optional vision and dental care, HSA, Simple IRA with employer match, paid vacation and sick/personal days, paid professional licensing and membership fees, CE offerings, and flexible scheduling. Salary commensurate with experience.

We would love to meet and discuss this opportunity with you! Please submit resume and cover letter through Indeed

- Dog handling skills

title: PT Sales Associate
description:
We are an American luxury brand known for beautiful, timeless pieces and rich storytelling that evokes optimism and joy. Tory is a fashion designer who draws inspiration from her parents’ effortless style, the worlds of travel, art and interiors, and women globally. The collections include ready-to-wear, handbags, footwear, accessories, jewelry, home and beauty. Empowering women is the company’s guiding principle, underpinning the design philosophy and company culture, and driving the work of the Tory Burch Foundation.

You are seeking a work environment where people are encouraged to dream, explore, discover and, as important, laugh together. If you’re prepared to work hard, create impact, and have fun while doing it, we would love to have you join #TeamTory. Apply today!

Life @ToryBurch is Special Because:

When you join us, you’re joining a purpose-led company on an exciting growth journey with the best Retail Team in the industry.

* Our culture is welcoming and inclusive -- everyone is empowered to make a difference.
* We have the best team in the world and believe in paying competitively and rewarding high performance.
* Your overall well-being is important to us; we offer benefits to help you take care of your mental and physical health, create financial security, and achieve wellness in all areas of your life.
* We love seeing our employees wear our beautiful collections. You’ll receive a generous employee discount and access to exclusive special offers.
* We will help you become great at what you love - Our Retail Excellence Programs in Styling, Coaching, Brand Ambassador (just to name a few) and supportive Retail Leaders are there to support you each step of the way
* We believe in the importance of giving back and you’ll have many opportunities to do just that through the Tory Burch Foundation and paid volunteer days.

This Role is Tailor-Made for You Because:

You are passionate about delivering a transformational client experience, building our brand one customer at a time and driving business through sales. You demonstrate a strong commitment to service, a genuine curiosity and interest in people, authenticity, fashion & style sensibility, and exceptional selling skills. You’re also resourceful and collaborative – a team player who is savvy about the visual and operational aspects of the role and committed to loss prevention. A sense of humor is a plus!

A Day in the Life:

The typical day is… atypical. You might be building and maintaining new and existing customer relationships to drive the business and meet personal sales goals, creating the customer experience through use of selling skills and extensive product knowledge, understanding and communicating the Tory Burch brand philosophy and lifestyle with each other and the customer while ensuring all sales and operational policies and procedures are followed and maintained. The consistent thread is that you’ll be working with an amazing team of women and men who share your passion for excellence.

To Land This Role:

* One-to-three years’ experience in a high volume, customer-driven retail environment
* Strong personal selling and customer relations experience, along with verbal and written communication skills
* Must have open availability for a flexible work schedule that meets the needs of the business, including overnights, evenings, holidays and weekend shifts
* Ability to lift (at least 40 lbs), carry, push, pull, squat, kneel, twist, turn, climb ladders, crawl, reach, bend and stand for extended periods of time

Why You’ll Want to Join Our Team:

title: High School Physical Education/Health Teacher
description:
Cardinal Spellman High School is the premier co-educational, college preparatory, Catholic High School in the New York Metropolitan Area. Our mission is to promote a culture of aspiration that encourages superior academic performance, leadership and service. We emphasize personal development and we foster a commitment to others that empowers our diverse student population to become leaders who make a difference in our community, nation and world.

We are seeking to employ a full-time Physical Education/Health teacher for the 2024-2025 school year.

The ideal candidate is a motivating and engaging teacher who is committed to serving a diversity of learners in an academically rigorous environment. While demonstrating a passion for teaching Physical Education/Health, the candidate will plan a curriculum that prepares students to meet the required NYS standards, CSHS standards, and fosters critical thinking and physical literacy. The candidate will also help students to think critically and independently and develop conﬁdence in their own abilities to construct healthy academic arguments and participate in discussions and debates on current issues.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

* Plan, prepare and deliver lesson plans and instructional materials that facilitate active learning
* Develop and use a variety of assessments (e.g., exams, written work, and physical activities) that frequently measure student progress
* Maintain an organized classroom environment that facilitates learning
* Communicate and maintain high academic expectations for all students

Other Professional Responsibilities:

* Actively participate in department and school-wide meetings, collaborative planning, and professional development
* Participate in teacher-parent conferences regarding students’ progress or concerns
* Perform supervisory duties such as homeroom, hall, and cafeteria
* Assist with class coverages
* Actively participate in opportunities to strengthen pedagogical skills
* Communicate and collaborate effectively with colleagues, families, and students
* Use data and assessments to inform and drive instruction
* Pursue their own self-discovery and growth

Qualifications:

* Bachelor’s degree with at least 1 year of teaching experience preferred
* New York State certification preferred
* Excellent oral and written communication skills
* Demonstrated commitment to equity and inclusion
* Energy, enthusiasm, and curiosity – willingness to be a fellow learner with students

We invite interested candidates to apply by emailing a cover letter and resume as indicated.

Cardinal Spellman High School is an equal employment opportunity employer committed to hiring exceptional, dedicated teachers of diverse backgrounds.

* Monday to Friday

title: Marketing Specialist
description:
We're seeking diligent, forward-looking, and driven candidates for an opportunity encompassing five developmental stages:

* Sales, Marketing, PR, Customer Service
* Team Leadership, Development
* Crew Management, Campaign Management
* Assistant Management, Recruitment
* Office Management, Client Relations

While Business Graduates are highly valued, we also welcome applicants from diverse educational backgrounds, career changers, and those seeking an entry-level position to showcase their capabilities!

This entry-level business role is situated in one of the top cities in the US, with travel opportunities available to exceptional performers within their first 6-12 months.

The Graduate Management Training Program Overview:

Your initial 3-5 days will focus on honing your conversational skills for events. It's likely that you'll secure your first few sales during this period, bolstering your confidence.

Within a few weeks, individuals excelling in event work can progress to the second stage of our Graduate Management Training Program. You'll also collaborate with the management team to establish specific advancement goals within the program.

Additional Perks of Joining Us:

We provide a blend of classroom-style instruction and hands-on training, ensuring you grasp both theory and practical application.

Our culture is team-centric, fostering support and collaboration rather than cutthroat competition.

Top performers can expect a plethora of incentives!

Training Program Requirements:

(In addition to being 18+ years old and authorized to work in the US)

* Proficient communication skills and a knack for sales or customer service.
* Genuine ambition to excel and the capacity to tackle challenging situations.
* Strong work ethic; in our domain, hard work directly correlates with earnings.
* Competitive spirit; backgrounds in sports are common in our industry.
* Resilience; this role demands fortitude as setbacks are inevitable.

Employment Type: Full-time (willingness to start within 1-3 days is advantageous)  
Compensation: Base Salary, Bonus

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Internship

Pay: $40,000.00 - $80,000.00 per year

Expected hours: 40 per week

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Work Location: In person

title: Produce Manager - RoNetco Supermarkets
description:
RoNetco Supermarkets, operator of nine ShopRite locations in Sussex, Morris, and Warren Counties is interviewing to fill produce department manager positions in multiple locations.

The produce department manager’s goal is to maintain a neat, clean, and visually appealing department that provides excellent customer service. The produce manager is responsible for all of the safety, security and assets in their department.

The produce manager oversees the store operations and activities of the staff while ensuring production processes, quality control and food safety guidelines are met. The produce manager must maintain a high level of productivity from the staff. This position needs to have the ability to communicate effectively with management and staff throughout multiple departments and shifts.

Our ideal candidate has:

· Experience with gross profits and managing shrink (product loss)

· Experience with inventory and sales

· Knowledge of product displays and presentation

Applicants must be comfortable providing excellent customer service and be available to work a flexible schedule including some nights and weekends. Must be able to lift up to 40lbs comfortably, job requires bending, squatting, twisting, reaching, lifting and standing for extended periods of time. Use of electric jack, manual jack, lift may be required.

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Shift:

* 8 hour shift
* Day shift
* Evening shift
* Morning shift
* Night shift

title: Medical Receptionist/Medical Assistant
description:
Penn Medicine - Becker ENT & Allergy is a fast-growing, multi-specialty practice with several locations throughout Philadelphia and Central and South Jersey. Our staff includes otolaryngologists, audiologists, facial plastic surgeons, allergists, speech-language pathologists, and nurse practitioners and we offer specialized care for a wide range of health problems.

We are looking for a Medical Receptionist to join our company in Central Jersey. This role is ideal for someone who has strong customer service skills and works well under pressure. By joining Penn Medicine Becker ENT & Allergy, you will be joining a practice with plenty of room for growth.

Job Duties:

* Greet patients and vendors
* Obtain and enter patient demographic information into the Epic System
* Check patients in and out
* Room patients, take their vital signs and input into the EMR System
* Schedule appointments for return and new patients
* Review any documents given to patient by provider
* Answer any incoming calls regarding scheduling appointments or prior authorizations for Imaging or Medication refills
* Assist the Providers in procedures
* Follow daily routine opening checklist and closing checklist
* Make sure each patient room is fully stocked
* Keep front reception area clean and organized
* Inform Office Manager if the office is running low on any office or medical supplies
* General clerical duties include but not limited to; scanning charts into the EMR system, follow up calls to patients, use of email, phone, computers, and Google Apps

As one of our Medical Receptionists, you set the tone with our patients. This is a great opportunity for someone looking for a full time position with a rapidly growing practice. We offer a competitive salary, excellent medical benefits, paid holidays, paid vacation time and a 401K plan.

***Please note in accordance with Governor Murphy's executive order and Penn Medicine guidelines, all employees must be covid vaccinated and boosted or apply for and receive a qualified medical or religious exemption.***

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Day shift
* Monday to Friday

Experience:

* Medical Receptionist: 1 year (Preferred)
* Medical Assistant: 1 year (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

title: Board Certified Assistant Behavior Analyst (BCABA)
description:
**Join our team of compassionate Behavior Analysts!**

Positive Behavior Supports Corporation ( PBS Corp ) is seeking dedicated Board Certified Behavior Analysts ( BCBAs and BCaBAs ) to join our dynamic regional teams. : **Why Join Team PBS? :**


At PBS Corp, we’re not just another ABA provider – we have been delivering top tier ABA services for over 15 years. Our company is led by Behavior Analysts with no private equity backing! Our team is dedicated to ensuring individuals receiving services meet their goals and that our BCBA / BCaBA team members have opportunities for professional development and support. You will thrive in an environment surrounded by supportive leaders and peers from the regional level and across the United States and Canada! We want to champion your growth and success!  

  



**What We Offer:**

As a Behavior Analyst with Team PBS, you’ll be a part of dynamic system that is tailored to fit your work preferences. Whether you’re seeking full-time hours or part-time flexibility, we have a position that suits your needs.  

  



* Competitive Wages: Enjoy industry-leading pay rates and opportunities for quarterly bonuses for both part-time and full-time analysts
* Our employees are paid weekly!
* Regional Support: Your local leadership is comprised of Behavior Analysts who support teams with administrative and clinical needs.
* Flexibility: Whether you prefer full-time or part-time hours, we accommodate your schedule and match you with cases that suit your availability
* Immediate Opportunities: Jumpstart your journey with cases available for an immediate start upon credentialing approval.
* Comprehensive Benefits: From health insurance to a 401k program (with match!) and more, we’ve got you covered (\\* benefits vary depending on employment agreements \\*)
* Flexible Time Off Policies and Paid Sick Leave
* Continuous Learning In House: Access our bank of free CEUs to complete at your own pace, join free CEU events, and take advantage of our university partnerships for tuition fee reductions with many major ABA programs.
* Annual state conference attendance benefits for qualifying staff
* ABA Technology built by BCBAs: Use our tools and apps to streamline work and enhance client outcomes
* Ability to transfer to any of our service locations
* Opportunities to work in varying settings depending on regional needs
Growth Opportunities: PBS is comprised of BCBAs at all levels and departments. See where your career will take you at Positive Behavior Supports!  
* 

  

**What You’ll Do:**

  

A Behavior Analyst ( BCBA / BCaBA) with Team PBS provides high quality ABA services to individuals achieve clinical goals. Behavior Analysts are responsible for:  

  



* Completing assessments and working directly with individuals to develop comprehensive behavior plans to achieve quality of life goals
* Implement behavior plans through direct intervention and supervision of support staff
* Collect data via PBS data collection systems
* Complete assessments, develop written reports and updates, complete graphical analyses within designated timelines and as set by funding source requirements
* Provide caregiver training (if applicable)
* Provide supervision of behavior assistants and/or RBTs
* Collaborate with caregivers and other service professionals to enhance and integrate intervention (if applicable)
* Attend regional meetings held by PBS Corp
* Complete session progress notes in a timely manner

  

Learn more about becoming an analyst with TeamPBS by applying today at TeamPBS.com  

  

**Qualifications You’ll Need:**

* Must have a BCBA or BCaBA certification
* Bachelor’s, Master’s, or Doctorate Level Degree in Applied Behavior Analysis or a related field
* Ability to pass a background check
* Working experience in ABA (including practicum / internship experience)
* Be available for in-person services

  

Positive Behavior Supports provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.
company_description: PBS Corp. is an agency committed to the using the principles of Applied Behavior Analysis to improve not only behavior, but also quality of life for the families we serve.

title: Reservations Supervisor
description:
**Additional Information** Pay: $32.08-$42.77/hour, Full-Time, Temporary position  

**Job Number** 24151051  

**Job Category** Reservations  

**Location** The Ritz-Carlton New York Central Park, 50 Central Park South, New York, New York, United States VIEW ON MAP  

**Schedule** Full-Time  

**Located Remotely?** N  

**Relocation?** N  

**Position Type** Non-Management  

**POSITION SUMMARY**

  



Oversee accuracy of room blocks, reservations, and group market codes. Communicate company values and/or culture to new employees. Review and implement new Reservations procedures. Process all reservation requests, changes, and cancellations received by phone, fax, or mail. Identify guest reservation needs and determine appropriate room type. Verify availability of room type and rate. Explain guarantee, special rate, and cancellation policies to callers. Accommodate and document special requests. Answer questions about property facilities/services and room accommodations. Follow sales techniques to maximize revenue. Input and access data in reservation system. Respond to any challenges found for accommodating rooming requests. Set-up proper billing accounts according to Accounting policies. Troubleshoot, resolve, and document guest issues and concerns or escalate/refer to appropriate individual.

  



Assist management in training, scheduling, counseling, and motivating and coaching employees; serve as a role model and first point of contact of the Guarantee of Fair Treatment/Open Door Policy process. Follow all company policies and procedures; ensure uniform and personal appearance are clean and professional; maintain confidentiality of proprietary information; protect company assets. Welcome and acknowledge all guests according to company standards; anticipate and address guests’ service needs; thank guests with genuine appreciation. Speak with others using clear and professional language; prepare and review written documents accurately and completely; answer telephones using appropriate etiquette. Develop and maintain positive working relationships with others. Comply with quality assurance expectations and standards. Read and visually verify information in a variety of formats. Move, lift, carry, push, pull, and place objects weighing less than or equal to 10 pounds without assistance. Perform other reasonable job duties as requested by Supervisors.

  



PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS


Education: High school diploma or G.E.D. equivalent.


Related Work Experience: At least 2-years of related work experience.


Supervisory Experience: At least 1 year of supervisory experience.


License or Certification: None

  


The pay range for this position is $32.08 to $42.77 per hour and may offer 401(k) plan, earned paid time off and/or sick leave, and other wellness benefits. Benefits may be subject to generally applicable eligibility, waiting period, contribution, and other requirements and conditions.  



*Marriott International is an equal opportunity employer. We believe in hiring a diverse workforce and sustaining an inclusive, people-first culture. We are committed to non-discrimination on any protected basis, such as disability and veteran status, or any other basis covered under applicable law.*

  

At more than 100 award-winning properties worldwide, The Ritz-Carlton Ladies and Gentlemen create experiences so exceptional that long after a guest stays with us, the experience stays with them. Attracting the world’s top hospitality professionals who curate lifelong memories, we believe that everyone succeeds when they are empowered to be creative, thoughtful and compassionate.

  

Every day, we set the standard for rare and special luxury service the world over and pride ourselves on delivering excellence in the care and comfort of our guests.
  

Your role will be to ensure that the “Gold Standards” of The Ritz-Carlton are delivered graciously and thoughtfully every day. The Gold Standards are the foundation of The Ritz-Carlton and are what guides us each day to be better than the next. It is this foundation and our belief that our culture drives success by which The Ritz Carlton has earned the reputation as a global brand leader in luxury hospitality. As part of our team, you will learn and exemplify the Gold Standards, such as our Employee Promise, Credo and our Service Values. And our promise to you is that we offer the chance to be proud of the work you do and who you work with.
  

In joining The Ritz-Carlton, you join a portfolio of brands with Marriott International. **Be** where you can do your best work, **begin** your purpose, **belong** to an amazing global team, and **become** the best version of you.

title: IT Operations Specialist - Intern
description:
SMBC Group is a top-tier global financial group. Headquartered in Tokyo and with a 400-year history, SMBC Group offers a diverse range of financial services, including banking, leasing, securities, credit cards, and consumer finance. The Group has more than 130 offices and 80,000 employees worldwide in nearly 40 countries. Sumitomo Mitsui Financial Group, Inc. (SMFG) is the holding company of SMBC Group, which is one of the three largest banking groups in Japan. SMFG’s shares trade on the Tokyo, Nagoya, and New York (NYSE: SMFG) stock exchanges.

  

In the Americas, SMBC Group has a presence in the US, Canada, Mexico, Brazil, Chile, Colombia, and Peru. Backed by the capital strength of SMBC Group and the value of its relationships in Asia, the Group offers a range of commercial and investment banking services to its corporate, institutional, and municipal clients. It connects a diverse client base to local markets and the organization’s extensive global network. The Group’s operating companies in the Americas include Sumitomo Mitsui Banking Corp. (SMBC), SMBC Nikko Securities America, Inc., SMBC Capital Markets, Inc., SMBC MANUBANK, JRI America, Inc., SMBC Leasing and Finance, Inc., Banco Sumitomo Mitsui Brasileiro S.A., and Sumitomo Mitsui Finance and Leasing Co., Ltd.

  

The anticipated salary range for this role is between $20.00 and $30.00. The specific salary offered to an applicant will be based on their individual qualifications, experiences, and an analysis of the current compensation paid in their geography and the market for similar roles at the time of hire. The role may also be eligible for an annual discretionary incentive award. In addition to cash compensation, SMBC offers a competitive portfolio of benefits to its employees.

**Role Description**
--------------------


SMBC Capital Markets, Inc. is seeking to hire an intern IT Operations specialist within its DevOps group. This is an important role requiring interaction with an array of technologists, possibly at globally disparate sites. The appropriate candidate will take part in responding to first tier application support for the Development Group, as well as specifying and implementing in-house IT operations support throughout the firm, drawing upon their automation, debugging, scripting and/or testing skills. They will gain demonstrable knowledge of key business processes and software infrastructure.

**Role Objectives**
-------------------

* Responding to first tier application support for the Development Group, recording details, analyzing and triaging the problem, tracking to problem resolution, documenting root cause analysis, reporting on and publishing KPI/KPO indicators.
* Assuming responsibility for the execution and completion of all automated, recurring IT jobs such that they meet their SLAs.
* Monitoring a diverse array of automated jobs on a daily basis.
* Investigating failures, providing fault analysis first level support; identifying and contacting additional support staff as necessary.
* Facilitating, conducting and/or automating debugging, testing, output collection, and software log analysis.
* Analyzing and recording the details surrounding all incidents and/or failures.
* Documenting and accumulating known IT support responses for training purposes.
* Restarting failed software jobs as necessary.
* Work with DevOps, development teams on developing DevOps CI/CD release pipelines.
* Assist DevOps team on the Cloud buildout/migration project.
* Develop and test scripts/programs to automate manual IT process.
* Perform Bitbucket, Jira, Confluence application administration and support on Atlassian Cloud
**Qualifications and Skills**
-----------------------------

* Working towards a four-year computer science or similar technology/engineering college degree.
* A general familiarity with software operations in both distributed and client-server environments.
* Excellent interpersonal skills to interact with developers, end-users, infrastructure, and IT security.
* Clear, authoritative, professional communications (listening, oral and written communications) and excellent follow through.
* Strong organizational and coordination skills are essential, as is the ability to focus on multiple projects simultaneously.
* Experience with Shell/PowerShell/Python scripting, Git, SQL are a plus.
* Proficiency with Microsoft Excel and other Office tools.
* Must possess a strong work ethic and analytical skills; interested in understanding complex, global software systems.
* Reliable; pays attention to details; possesses the ability to both troubleshoot and reason about software behaviors.
* Has strong communication skills and is able to work independently within a team environment.
* Programming and/or scripting skills are preferred.
**Additional Requirements**
---------------------------


SMBC’s employees participate in a hybrid workforce model that provides employees with an opportunity to work from home, as well as, from an SMBC office. SMBC requires that employees live within a reasonable commuting distance of their office location. Prospective candidates will learn more about their specific hybrid work schedule during their interview process.

  

We are an equal employment opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law. SMBC provides reasonable accommodations for employees and applicants with disabilities consistent with applicable law. If you need a reasonable accommodation during the application process, please let us know at accommodations@smbcgroup.com.
